abstract: New strategy being deployed in the Bronx is showing success at coaxing chronic homeless people to move inside; Bloomberg administration says it has been able to lure them off streets by opening smaller and more welcoming shelters it calls Safe Havens, which typically have about 40 beds each; city estimates that number of single, homeless people in borough has dropped roughly 80 percent since 2005.
snippet: A different approach to providing housing is having success at convincing the chronic homeless to move inside.
lead_paragraph: A different approach to providing housing is having success at convincing the chronic homeless to move inside.

headline.main: Smaller Shelters and Persuasion Coax Homeless Off Bronx Streets

headline.seo: N.Y.C. Makes Progress Helping Bronx’s Chronic Homeless Adults
